## Reading my WEb --> WEbscraping
- Extracting data from HTML code of websites
- Check wiki --> web_scraping
- can use readlines()

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r web scrape} 
data <- url("https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=HI-I6C0AAAAJ&hl=en") #opens conection
html_code <- readLines(data)
close(data) #closes connection
#head(html_code)
```
Can use the XML package to parse data from HTML code
```{parsing}
library(XML)
url <- "http://scholar.google.com/citations?user=HI-I6C0AAAAJ&amp;hl=en"
html <- htmlTreeParse(url)

xpathSApply(html, "//title", xmvalue)

xpathSApply(html, "//td[@id='col-citedby']", xmvalue)
```
## Reading from get command (httr package)
- library(httr)

``` {httr}
library(httr)
html2 = GET("http://scholar.google.com/citations?user=HI-I6C0AAAAJ&amp;hl=en")
content2 = content(html2, as="text")

```


Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
